ar.169-error: Devices have been found, but some have been returned with an IP address of 169.254 which means that it was not able to obtain the correct ip address from your router. Please try unplugging your devices that are showing an ip address that starts with 169.254 and trying to search again
ar.ableton-connected: Ableton Link is now connected. Make sure you press Link in ableton to connect
ar.ableton-link-is-required: Ableton Link is required to be on before connecting to Lumia

ar.broadlink-press-lock-off: At the bottom of the Property page you'll see a setting to Lock your device, make sure this is off

ar.chatgpt-create-secret-key: Next press Create new secret key
ar.chatgpt-head-to-api-keys: Open up the ChatGPT API Keys web page
ar.chatgpt-paste-secret-key: Then copy your newly created key and paste it on this page
ar.chatgpt-press-next: Press Next and you will be good to go. You will see a new ChatGPT command created under Commands > Chat Bot Commands > ChatGPT. This command will allow you to start typing !chatgpt and start talking to ChatGPT right away

ar.deepseek-press-next: Press Next and you will be good to go. You will see a new DeepSeek command created under Commands > Chat Bot Commands > DeepSeek. This command will allow you to start typing !deepseek and start talking to DeepSeek right away

ar.complete-registration: Complete your registration by creating a Username and Password
ar.corsair-auth: Make sure Corsair ICue is on. If your device isn't found, in iCUE, go to device settings and ensure that Enable full software control option is checked for the Ram Modules
ar.corsair-not-found: Make sure Corsair ICue Software is on
ar.keep-old-hue-groups: Would you like to keep your older Lumia Stream groups that were created previously?
ar.donordrive-auth-failed: Authentication Failed, Make sure you enter the correct id as an individual or the id for your team
ar.entity-description: Tips credited to event, team, or individual
ar.extralife-auth-failed: Authentication Failed, Make sure you enter the correct id as an individual or the id for your team
ar.facebook-admin-error: You must be an admin or manage a page in order to use Facebook with Lumia Stream
ar.fast-mode-tip: (Experimental) Recommended for using with Fuze. Using Fast Mode diabled native themes for Hue, and it only allows up to 10 hue lights
ar.generic-connection: Make sure your {{connection}} are on and connected to your wifi network
ar.generic-connection-devices: Make sure your {{connection}} devices are on and connected
ar.generic-not-found: Make sure {{connection}} lights are connected to the network, and then press Search again
ar.generic-not-found-plus-manual: Make sure {{connection}} lights are connected to the network, and then press Search again. Or enter the ip address manually
ar.govee-credentials-incorrect: Govee Token was incorrect. Please try to enter it again
ar.govee-disclaimer: If you cannot activate LAN control inside of the Govee app your lights may not be supported or Govee is limiting your lights. You will need to contact Govee support in this case to ask why LAN control cannot be activated

ar.govee-select-v2-and-press-search: In the settings below Select the V2 Local API and press Check and then Search. Then your lights will be found and you will be good to go
ar.govee-token-request: Request an API token from the Govee phone app (My Profile > About Us > Apply for API Key)
ar.govee-turn-on-lan-control: Select each light within the Govee app and press the Settings icon. There if your light is compatible you will see a way to activate LAN control. Activate it
ar.govee-update-app-and-lights: Make sure the Govee app is updated on your phone to the latest version. Now select each light within the app to make sure each light is updated as well
ar.govee-wait-for-email: The email with your API key is normally sent right away. After you receive the email copy the API in the email and paste it in the token field on the left
ar.goveelan-no-lights: Make sure your Govee lights are wifi enabled and connected to the network, and then press Search. Bluetooth govee lights will not work

ar.kick-auth-failed: Authentication failed. If you have an _ (underscore) in your username try replacing it with a - (dash). Example Lumia_Stream would be Lumia-Stream
ar.kick-is-experimental: Kick is Experimental, you may experience issues while using this integration. Currently the only alerts that can be used are First Chatter and Entrance alerts. Follows and Subscriber alerts as well as Chat Bot support will be coming in a future update
ar.kick-login: A new window will pop up that asks you to login. Login and leave this window open in the background to use Kick with Lumia Stream. Make sure you're on your live page on this window so Lumia Stream can listen to events. If it tells you to login using the mobile app, try loggin in with the "Use QR code" option instead

ar.nowplaying-create-new-app: Create new app and name it Lumia Stream

ar.vlc-http-enable: Enable HTTP by going to VLC and pressing Tools > Preferences. Under the Interface tab you will see Show all at the bottom, select All. On the Sidebar under Interface > Main interfaces, select Web. Expand Main Interface and now press Lua and set a password under Lua HTTP. Close VLC completely and open it back up. Then enter your password below and it will connect

lumia.upgrade-to-premium-to-use: Upgrade To Premium To Use This Feature
lumia.variation-premium-hint: Customize alerts for every scenario. Allows you to specify conditions for a truly unique experience. Have different alerts for raids of different sizes, tip amounts, different currencies and so much more
lumia.premium-commands-no-add: Starter Chat commands are limited to max of 8 commands, upgrade to premium for more commands

automations.automations-description: Set a time to trigger any of your commands, use Crypto values to change your lights, send a chat bot message every x minutes, and so much more
automations.chat-lines-description: Minimum number of Chat Lines required to activate the automation

input.filewatcher-control-description: Trigger a command on file/folder changes. For instance you can listen for log changes in games to trigger different commands in Lumia. Or you can change the OBS source when a file is added to a folder
input.filewatcher-state-description: When activated Lumia will listen to changes in the tied files and folders
input.no-input-binds: No input binds added. Press Add to create one

input.newest-lines-start-on-bottom: Newest content start at bottom of file
input.limit-number-of-lines: Limit number of lines to read when file changes
input.use-polling: Use polling for games that continuously write to the file without saving
input.regex-watch: Regex to use that will trigger when the files content matches the regex. For example, if you want to trigger when a file has the word 'error' in it, use the regex `.*error.*`. Leave blank to trigger on all changes
input.regex-watch-folder: Regex to use that will trigger on the file name. For example, if you want to trigger on all .log files, use the regex `.*\.log`. Leave blank to trigger on all changes
input.url-only-premium: Only Premium members can create a special URL
input.input-webhook-description: Use webhooks to trigger Lumia commands from various apps and services with simple get commands
input.hotkeys-description: Bind Keyboard Hot keys to commands

input.recording-mqtt-events: Recording MQTT topics. Click here to stop
input.recording-serial-events: Recording Serial topics. Click here to stop
input.recording-broadlink-events: Recording Broadlink topics. Click here to stop

input.give-velocity-a-name: Your velocity value is mainly used for the Direct Control type that can be used to dynamically change the brightness or color values dynamically
input.velocity-range-description: Typically velocity maps from 0 to 127, however you can change the range for instance if you would like 127 to equal 255 for an RGB value and 0 to equal 0. It will scale the values in between to match.
input.max-name-length: Max length for name is 30 characters
input.folder-will-only-trigger: Folder watcher will only trigger when a file is added to this exact folder

eventlist.delete-eventlist-item-description: Deleting an Event List activity is irreversible. Would you like to delete this event list activity from {{username}}

library.infrared-description: When a Broadlink Device is connectd you can now learn infrared codes that you can use in Commands and Alerts
library.no-infrared-codes: No Infrared/RF Codes have been learned, Please Add to create one
library.press-start-recording: Press Start Recording to register a new code on your device
library.point-your-infrared-remote: Recording: Point your infrared remote at the receiver and press the key that you want to record
library.create-new-codes-in-library: You have to setup IR and RF codes in the Library first
library.point-your-rf-remote: Recording: Point your RF remote at the receiver and press and hold the key that you want to record. This could take up to 30 seconds. If hold does not work, try a combination of holding and pressing continuously

default.default-devices: Default Key Lights and Smart Plug States
default.dynamically-error-set-default-state: Can't set default state to {{value}} as this is an invalid default type
default.devices-description: Choose the Key Lights and Smart Plugs that you need to be triggered when default state is triggered

default.no-default-devices: No Key Lights or Smart Plugs Added
default.devices-on-disconnect: Turn off all default Key Lights and smart plugs on disconnect
default.audio-mac-warning: Mac can only listen to audio inputs. This is a limitation that Apple sets on us, but there's a bypass if you use a third party app called soundflower
default.default-lights-description: The state that your lights return to after being changed
default.default-dynamic-popover-info:
After a user has triggered a command, it will temporarily replace the previous default state. E.g. user types '!red'. Lights will remain red until the next color is triggered. 'Alerts' always will revert back to the original default state. 
 'Alerts', 'Reactions', 'No Light change' and 'Buildups' cannot be dynamic defaults.
default.default-off-lights-popover-info: lights will be turned off when lumia is off
default.default-delay-revert-popover-info: lights will switch to default state after the delay is done. Use this if some of your lights get stuck after an intense activity

studio.no-preview: Select a scene or switch Buildups type to color to see a preview here.  If you don't have any scenes, you can add them from the Studio Scenes page
studio.duplicate: Studio must have a unique name
studio.scenes-description: Scenes create a vibrant environment that can instantly change the atmosphere of your stream
studio.confirm-removing-actions: Would you like to remove your old actions in favor of the custom code ones

studio.animations-description: With animations your streams will really come to life! Animations can set, control, and order, any and everything.
studio.themes-description: Themes allow you to use your own Native light scenes, themes and effects within Lumia

studio.scene-living-type-3: Moves each light in the scene slot randomly

studio.heartratesync-trigger-down: Trigger alerts when heart rate is dropping
studio.delete-title: Are you sure you want to delete {{name}}?
studio.delete-description: You will not be able to recover this item!
studio.theme-audio-description: Choose audio file to be played with the theme
studio.living-scene-description: Turn your scene into a living breathing scene
studio.screen-info: If the prefered display can't be found Fuze will choose the first display
studio.sensitivity-description: Below 100% will make the volume less sensitive

studio.choose-target: Choose the targeted item to change
studio.step-description: How many triggers are considered one step

Please change the cycle time to atleast {{recommended}} seconds to have a smooth experience. Or change your lights to fast mode with a recommended cycle duration of {{fastRecommended}} seconds

commands.set-point-value: Set points value to redeem to
commands.set-point-value-description: You can use basic math like +100, -100, =300, or even *2 to add, subtract, set, multiply, and divide from the current point value. This is useful for doing things like increasing the point value everytime someone redeems
commands.set-bits-value: Set bits value to redeem to

commands.title: Title

variables.actions: Send an action or multiple generic actions
variables.api_action_global_response: Response retrieved from recently triggered api action (JSON strigified); use delay to await response

variables.avatar: (Twitch) The url of the avatar of the sender for a Twitch message

variables.ball_position: The position where the ball lands in a game.
variables.bits: (Twitch) How many bits were used with the Twitch Extension redemption
variables.callAlert: Call an alert based on your conditions. You can also call a variation given it's name. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.
variables.callAlertVar: Call an alert based on your conditions. You can also call a variation given it's name. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.
variables.callCommand: Call a command based on your conditions. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.
variables.callTrovoSpell: Call a trovo spell command based on your conditions. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.
variables.callTwitchExtension: Call a twitch extension command based on your conditions. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.
variables.callTwitchPoint: Call a twitch point command based on your conditions. When calling an alert/command from custom code the variableValues will be inherited from the parent, but you can also override variable values by passing it in to the call function.

Then use it like this: !command username or !command username,platform. Result will be the point ballance without currency

settings.not-compatible-streaming-app-description: Our collection of services grows with every update. If your service is not offered already head to our "Request" page and add it there and we will do our best to implement it
settings.tech-issues-description: You can always ask for help on our Discord server. You can also find a ton of guides on our forum for anything you would like to do with Lumia Stream
settings.missing-feature-description: You can always submit a request and we'll try to add it or even find a workaround.
settings.other-description: Also, you can join us on our Discord and we are more than happy to get rid of any issues you face.
settings.submit-request: You can always submit a request and we'll work to figure it out
settings.switch-plans-confirmation: Are you sure you want to change plans?
settings.auto-convert-currency-description: Lumia can auto convert currency if it does not match your default currency using todays exchange rates
settings.reset-donations-confirm: Are you sure you want to reset all of your tips? This will reset your variations. Overlay goals, and Overlay labels back to 0
settings.edit-performance-confirmation: These settings should not be changed unless you know exaclty what you're doing
settings.edit-performance-second-confirmation: Changing these settings could cause Lumia Stream to not fuction as intended. Are you sure you would like to proceed?
settings.performance-description: If Lumia Stream is lagging or disconnecting it's possible that you may have to disable some settings that you aren't using. This list is in order from most intensive to least. Before disabling all settings try to do them one by one and see if it solves your issues
settings.ignoreWatchers: Ignore retrieving watchers for your stream. This can cause a heavy burden on Lumia if you have too many viewers
settings.ignoreFollowsPolling: Ignore retrieving followers for your stream. This can cause a heavy burden on Lumia if you have too many followers, but it will limit functionality for Lumia like chat commands for Followers, overlay variables for follows, and counts for follows
settings.ignoreSubsPolling: Ignore retrieving subscribers for your stream. This can cause a heavy burden on Lumia if you have too many subs, but it will limit functionality for Lumia like chat commands for Subsribers, overlay variables for subs, and counts for subs
settings.ignoreModsPolling: Ignore retrieving mods on your stream
settings.ignoreClipsPolling: Ignore retrieving clips for your stream. This will cause clip alerts to not work
settings.ignoreUserAvatars: Ignore retrieving user avatars for your stream. This can cause a heavy burden on Lumia if you have too many chatters, but this will limit functionality for displaying users avatars on the event list and chat box on overlays
settings.ignoreUserBadges: Ignore retrieving user badges for your stream. This can cause a slight burden on Lumia if you have too many chatters, but this will limit functionality for displaying users badges on the chat box on overlays
settings.ignoreAllChat: Ignore all chat for your stream. This can cause a heavy burden on Lumia if you have too many chatters, but will limit all Lumia's chat functionality including overlays
settings.beta-disclamer: Be careful beta releases are still in the testing phase. It could be unstable.
settings.remux-to-mp4: Remux All OBS Replays to MP4. Turn this off if you do not have Remux on in OBS and do not want to use the MP4 value
settings.user-restricted: User trying to enter raffle is restricted
settings.out-of-range: User Guess is out of range
settings.stop-to-get-winner: When Raffle is not stopped to get winner
settings.no-entry-to-win: No entry left to win in raffle
settings.interaction-chatbot-deactivated: {{interaction}} chatbot is deactivated no feedback will be provided to the user when something happen
settings.interaction-settings-info: Define what message will be sent via chatbot about the state of raffle, poll, viewer queue
settings.confirmation-revoke: This will disconnect any signed in Lumia account. Are you sure you want to revoke access?
settings.confirmation-delete: Permanantly deleting your account is irreversible. Are you sure you want to delete?
settings.revoke-description: By revoking access, you'll effectively disconnect all devices currently signed in to your Lumia Stream account
settings.delete-account-description: Permanently deleting your account, everything disapears â€“ profiles, settings, overlays..., with no trace left behind
settings.delete-success: Your account has been deleted successfully, have a luminous day ðŸ˜¢
settings.session-check-based-on-last-session: Check based on last session instead of on Date. When checked the session will be checked based on the last session instead of on the actual date. So weekly would be 7 days since the last session instead of on the first day of the week

billing.reload-required-text: To reflect your premium settings Lumia Stream needs to restart. Would you like to restart now?
billing.premium-expires-soon: Your premium membership is about to expire soon!

keymouse-outputs.mouse-record-delay: Mouse position will be recorded in 3 seconds so you have time to get your mouse in position

toast.points-generic-warning:
We do not recommend using Generic type anymore unless you absolutely have to. When using Direct type we handle creating the corresponding twitch point on your channel, updating the colors, pausing the reward when Lumia turns off as well as Fulfilling or Refunding automatically as needed. 
If you would like to use a generic Color command for your Points, use an Interactive with the type of color.
toast.points-too-main-error: Twitch only allows up to 50 Twitch points on a channel. Please delete a few rewards to leave room for more. If you would like to have a command that handles all generic colors, look into using Interactives
toast.points-banned-word-error: Twitch does not allow banned words. Please check the list of banned words and make sure your Point Redemptions do not include any of these words
toast.points-duplicate-error: There is already a Reward with this name. Please remove it from Twitch and try linking again
toast.points-missing-scope: In order for Lumia to manage your Twitch points, we require the Manage Channel Points permission. Please head to Connections > Edit Twitch and authenticate again
toast.points-cost-greater-0: Twitch Point Cost must be higher than 0
toast.points-not-available: Twitch Channel Points are not available for you to use. Twitch requires users to be affiliate to use Channel Points
toast.points-generic-error: Ran into an error creating the corresponding Reward on Twitch. In order for Lumia to manage your Twitch points, we require the Manage Channel Points permission. Please head to Connections > Edit Twitch and authenticate again
toast.points-background-color-invalid: Background color was invalid, try editing the color of the command and trying again
toast.points-id-not-found: We could not find the corresponding reward on Twitch, please delete the command and create it again
toast.points-automod-banned: We could not create this reward. The word in the title or description may include one of Twitch's banned words. Please try again without any banned words included
toast.points-error: Ran into an error creating corresponding Reward on Twitch, please try again.

overlay.preview-info: You can test your Overlay by triggering commands from the control center shortcuts at the top right
overlay.link-copied: Link Copied! Paste this into an OBS browser source
overlay.obs-source-created: OBS browser source created directly on OBS

overlay.set-hotkey: Click here to change Hot Key

overlay.open-hud: Open this HUD when Lumia opens

chatbot.chatbot-description: Give Lumia Stream the ability to convey what's going on inside of Lumia in chat with our Chat Bot. Make sure you mod Lumia Stream with /mod lumiastream in your twitch chat
chatbot.commands-description: !commands - You may use the {{commands_url}} variable to check out the list of your commands
chatbot.lights-description: !lights - You may use the {{username}} template to fill in the users name as well as commands to list the commands the user can trigger
chatbot.lightslist-description: !lightslist - You may use the friendly names that you've set for each tier. If you use a friendly name and change it later on, remember to update it here
chatbot.here-description: Enable The Is Here Message On Start
chatbot.changing-description: Enable The Is Changing Color Message
chatbot.twitchextension-redeem-description: Enable The Chat Bot Twitch Extension Redeem Message
chatbot.busy-description: Enable The Lumia Is Busy Message
chatbot.allowed-variables-info: Copy and paste these variables to the input to make a generic message

tutorials.widget-btn-description: You can remove or add widgets from the dashboard by clicking the manage widgets button
tutorials.widget-modal-description: This is the list of the the available widgets, you can toggle to show/hide widgets by clicking on the one you prefer
tutorials.quit-tutorial: Are you sure you want to quit the Lumia Stream tutorial?
tutorials.skip-tutorial: Are you ready to move on to the next tutorial section?
tutorials.tutorial-start: Welcome to the Lumia Stream interactive tutorial
tutorials.dashboard-stats-tutorial: Stats keeps track of all your activities in the Lumia Stream app. You can add up to 3 favorites by clicking the settings icon in the top right of this section and favoriting each item with the star
tutorials.queue-tutorial: This is the queue. Here you will be able to view the order of all incoming commands and the users who sent them
tutorials.cooldown-tutorial: This is the cooldown table. You can view the commands and users currently in cooldowns here
tutorials.connections-tutorial: This is the connections section.  From here, you can see all services and devices connected to Lumia.  A green check means a successful connection, while a red text means it's not connected. Either it's off or you need to manually reconnect
tutorials.logs-tutorial: You can view all Lumia logs in the logs section.  This includes alerts, chat commands, chat bot, system messages, and more. If anything weird is going on in Lumia make sure you check here to see what's going on
tutorials.default-lights-tutorial: Control your default light settings from here
tutorials.default-lights-type-tutorial: Try choosing a default light type by clicking one of these buttons now!
tutorials.default-lights-config-tutorial: This is where you can customize the settings for your chosen default light type. Different types will have different configuration options
tutorials.default-general-tutorial: Define the default behavior for the Lumia app here. Hover over each option to see what each one does
tutorials.default-idle-tutorial: You can customize what Lumia does after there hasn't been any activity in chat after some time. Animations or Fuze are great options to have as an idle state
tutorials.default-devices-tutorial: This section allows you to add and edit which Key Lights and Smart Plugs will be triggered on default state
tutorials.connections-page-tutorial: This is the connections page.  You can add, delete, or edit any of the services and devices that Lumia is connected to from this page. If you're having an issue with a connection, the first step is to edit the connection, and if that still doesn't work, delete the connection and add it again
tutorials.connections-actions-tutorial: For each connection you have the option to toggle it on or off, edit, or delete the connection. Some connections like Philips hue and Nanoleaf also give you the option to turn on/off Fast mode as well
tutorials.add-connection-tutorial: This button allows you to connect to a new light, device, or streaming seervice.  For services, you will be able to specify app permisions from the next page
tutorials.queue-page-tutorial: The queue page gives you a birds eye view to see all of the incoming lighting commands from your chat. You can view the History as well as replay previous commands as well
tutorials.queue-current-tutorial: The Current tab will show all of your incoming commands in the order that commands have been arranged in based on your Queue Settings
tutorials.queue-done-tutorial: The Done tab will show all commands that are complete. You can also choose to replay finished commands from here
tutorials.queue-settings-tutorial: Click here to edit your queue settings
tutorials.commands-chat-tutorial: Welcome to the commands section.  Let's take a look around!  We'll start with chat commands
tutorials.commands-chat-folders: Folders is a section where you get to arrange your commands as groups
tutorials.commands-chat-list-tutorial: This is a list of all of your chat commands.  You can preview your commands by hovering over them, test them with the test button, and edit them with the "Edit" dropdown on the right
tutorials.commands-chat-match-nav: Chat match gives you the ability to trigger commands based on what's been typed in chat. You can use Regex to do things like have your light quickly flash for any message that comes in to Lumia as an example
tutorials.commands-chat-userlevel-nav: Setup custom User Levels in this section to give certain users on your stream different commands that they can use
tutorials.commands-chat-cooldown-nav: Cooldowns gives you the option to limit how many times a command can be used in a certain amount of time or even how many times a user can redeem a command in a certain amount of time
tutorials.commands-chat-globalsettings-nav: Global chat settings like changing the ! key to something else, disabling all chat commands, and more can be found here
tutorials.commands-chat-search-tutorial: You can search Lumia for specific commands by their name
tutorials.commands-chat-global-tutorial: Use this page to edit the global chat settings for Lumia Stream
tutorials.commands-chat-match-tutorial: This listens to any message which equals the regex value '.' A dot means that every message will trigger this chat match
tutorials.commands-user-level-tutorial: This page is to edit and add user levels. In commands, you can set up which user level may use that specific command
tutorials.commands-twitchpoints-tutorial: Using Twitch Points in Lumia Stream is a breeze. It will handle auto fulfilling requests, refunding, pausing/hiding your redemptions when Lumia Stream turns off and much more
tutorials.commands-twitchpoints-state: If you want to activate or deactivate Twitch Points, do it here
tutorials.commands-trovospells-tutorial: This page allows you to control the way that Lumia handles Trovo Spells
tutorials.commands-trovospells-state: If you want to activate or deactivate Trovo Spells, do it here
tutorials.commands-twitchpoints-type-tutorial: Determine whether users redeem their points as "Direct" or "Generic". Direct Will check how much the point is worth and will trigger the title of the reward. Generic allows the user to enter a message with the commands name when redeeming to trigger any of your point commands. We recommend sticking with Direct
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-tutorial: Twitch Extensions gives your viewers the ability to trigger commands directly in your Twitch panel, video, or as a full screen popup without needing to type in chat
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-state: If you want to activate or deactivate Twitch Extensions, do it here
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-download: You'll first need to install the extension on your Twitch channel by clicking the link here. After that your settings will be sent to the extension for users to use
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-list-tutorial: This is a list of all of your Twitch Extension commands.  You can preview your commands by hovering over them, test them with the test button, and edit them with the "Edit" dropdown on the right.  If you want to disable a command so it doesn't show on extension, just turn the state button off
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-order-tutorial: Change the order of how your Twitch Extensions show up on your stream by dragging and dropping the commands where you want them
tutorials.alert-page-tutorial: This page allows you to customize Lumia's alerts
tutorials.alert-type-tutorial: Use these tabs to select what type of alert you want to customize
tutorials.alert-only-variation-tutorial: You can now decide whether the base alert will always be triggered, or whether the alert will only trigger if a variation condition is fulfilled
tutorials.base-alert-tutorial: Customize the lights, smart plugs, TTS, audio states, and much more for your alert here
tutorials.alert-variations-tutorial: Variations allows you to trigger different alerts based on the conditions. For instance you can have a police siren go off when you receive a tip of more than $100
tutorials.welcome-tutorial: Welcome to the new and improved Lumia Stream!  Let's take a look around the app to see what's changed.  We'll start with the Dashboard.  You can skip to the next section or quit the tutorial entirely with the "Skip" or "X" buttons
tutorials.default-state-tutorial: The Default State page allows you to control all of the lights and device settings you'd like Lumia to default to when Lumia turns on as well as what it should return to after a command or an alert
tutorials.studio-tutorial: The Studio page contains Lumia's most essential tools. You can add all sorts of effects, colors, reactions and more to your stream here. You can then bind them into Alerts, Chat Commands, Twitch Points, etc.
tutorials.studio-scenes-tutorial: Studio scenes offers a way to assign different lights to different colors that can be triggered at once. You can also use scenes inside of Reactions and Animations to supercharge your commands and alerts by offering way more customizability
tutorials.studio-reactions-tutorial: Studio reactions gives you the ability to setup a sequence of events that happen in a set order. Every slot will be an equal amount of time
tutorials.studio-animations-tutorial: Studio animations gives you the ability to setup advanced sequences that are much more powerful than reactions. Individually change the duration, target individual lights, play an audio, trigger smart plugs, Keylight, MIDI, OSC, MQTT and so much more inside each individual slot. These are Studio Reactions on steroids
tutorials.studio-themes-tutorial: Studio themes allows you to select native lights scenes and themes. Certain lights like Nanoleaf and Lifx have effects that can have your lights bounce around however you like
tutorials.studio-buildups-tutorial: Studio buildups starts a buildups event when triggered. Lights will start at 0 brightness and move up based on how many emotes come in from your users.
tutorials.studio-fuze-tutorial: Studio fuze starts either a reactive mirror of your screen grabbing the average colors of what's showing on your screen or you can turn your lights into an audio visualizer. If you need to change your Audio input/output in Lumia, you can change it in the Settings page
tutorials.studio-preview-tutorial: Each Studio page will display a preview of the commands you've added. You'll also have the option to copy, edit, delete, or test any studio command
tutorials.studio-search-tutorial: The search bar can help you find exactly what you're looking for
tutorials.global-state-tutorial: You can turn on and off chat commands from this section
tutorials.global-key-tutorial: Customize the key that your viewers will use to send chat commands (default is "!")
tutorials.global-cooldown-tutorial: In Cooldown Settings, you can set up a global cooldown. You can put individual cooldowns in the commands individually
tutorials.global-restrictions-tutorial: Restrictions gives you the power to stop certain users from sending commands. Turn on Restrictions and simply enter their usernames to restrict them from your channel
tutorials.global-user-levels-tutorial: Use this section to edit viewer tiers and permissions. Newly added to the Revamp is also a way to make custom user levels. So you can now tie specific users to chat commands if you so please
tutorials.overlay-page-tutorial: Lumia offers a few options for dynamic overlays to enhance your streams
tutorials.activate-overlay-tutorial: Acitvate your overlays by clicking here. You will then receive a link where you can add dynamic overlays that will match your lights colors live
tutorials.edit-overlay-tutorial: Click the edit button to change how your Overlays look
tutorials.delete-overlay-tutorial: Delete Overlay by clicking this button
tutorials.duplicate-overlay-tutorial: Duplicate Overlay so that you have the exact copy saved as a backup and you can do what ever you want with it
tutorials.add-new-connection-overlay-tutorial: Click the add button to create a new Overlay
tutorials.open-hud-overlay-tutorial: Hud allows you to display your overlay directly in you screen so if you don't have more space you can use the overlay as to show your chat pinned on your screen
tutorials.open-in-obs-overlay-tutorial: Click Open in OBS to add your Overlay directly to OBS
tutorials.chatbot-page-tutorial: Chat Bot is a great helper for Lumia that communicates with your community about what's going on inside of Lumia Stream! After activating the chat bot you can setup chat commands that the chat bot can react to in various ways. You can even combine it with custom javascript code to do all types of things
tutorials.activate-chatbot-tutorial: Activate Lumia Chat Bot from here and you'll be able to edit all of your settings
tutorials.settings-page-tutorial: All of Lumia's main settings can be handled from here
tutorials.user-info-tutorial: Use this section to edit your account password. To edit username and email please head to https://lumiastream.com
tutorials.profiles-tutorial: Lumia allows you to set up multiple profiles with different settings on each
tutorials.subscription-tutorial: Edit or upgrade your Lumia subscription from this section
tutorials.general-settings-tutorial: These settings establish how Lumia Stream behaves on your computer
tutorials.languages-tutorial: Lumia Stream now comes with a set of standard translations.  Check this section to see if your local language is supported
tutorials.reset-settings-tutorial: You can always reset Lumia's settings to default if you want a clean slate
tutorials.default-audio-tutorial: Change your default input and output audio devices at any time
tutorials.advanced-tutorial: These settings are for our advanced users who want to explore the additional possibilities of Lumia Stream
tutorials.hotkey-page-tutorial: Add hotkeys to trigger any of your existing Lumia commands
tutorials.hotkey-display-tutorial: If you've added any hotkeys, you'll be able to view and edit them here
tutorials.community-tutorial: Welcome to the community page!  Here you can find and download all of the innovative Colors, Scenes, Reactions, and Animations that the Lumia community has created.  And if you've got any you're proud of, you can upload your own here as  well!
tutorials.community-items-list-tutorial: Check out the great list of community shares here.  Click on the preview to view or download a share
tutorials.community-search-tutorial: If you already know the name of the community command you want, you can search for it here
tutorials.community-type-tutorial: You can filter the community page by command type. Colors, Scenes, Reactions, and Animations are all availabe for downloading and sharing
tutorials.community-filter-tutorial: You can also sort commands by Newest, Most Popular, or Alphabetical
tutorials.community-post-tutorial: Now you're ready to share your first command!  Come back to this page if you'd ever like to share any of your Colors, Scenes, Reactions, or Animations to the Lumia community!
tutorials.chat-add-command-name-field: type in a unique name that you wanna use for your command
tutorials.chat-add-command-save: press submit and your command will be added
tutorials.heartratesync-page: You can sync your heart beat to Lumia Stream using Heart Rate Sync. Use Heart Rate Sync as a Default State or chat command to make your lights beat at the same rate as your heart
tutorials.commands-chat-global-settings-tutorial: In this page you will be able to disable the whole commands by disabling the global state and change the global key for all the commands
tutorials.commands-twitch-point-global-state-tutor: You can disable global state and all you twitch point won't be working
tutorials.commands-twitch-point-type-tutorial: You have two choices direct which is the default where every twitch point will work, and 'Generic' which will trigger only the commands that you have in the input
tutorials.commands-twitch-point-auto-fulfill-tutor: You can allow Lumia Stream to take care of the auto refund twitch point
tutorials.commands-twitch-point-auto-stop-play-tut: Allow auto play and pause when you turn off Lumia stream or you can do that manualy
tutorials.commands-twitch-point-pause-when-off-tut: You can control how twitch point behave hidden by default or pausing the reward
tutorials.commands-twitch-extension-leader-bord-tu: Here when you can see all your twitch extension history and all that users classed by order
tutorials.input-tutorial: Input Control allow you to tie Keybinds, OSC, MIDI, and MQTT to commands and events that can be triggered in Lumia
tutorials.add-input-tutorial: Click Add Bind to add a hotkey and configure what it does
tutorials.automation-page-tutorial: Automations give you the power to set up any task on a schedule. This can be from a chat bot message that sends every 30 minutes all the way to receiving an alert when Bitcoin rises above $50k again
tutorials.variables-page-tutorial: Variables give you the power to save or view things in the app. Variables can be user created, but we also have a ton of System created ones like Twitch Follower Count, Commands URL and so on
tutorials.filtered-words-settings-tutorial: In this section you get to choose which words that you don't want to be on your stream, this will replace all the TTS, chat bot messages with the word that you choose 'FILTERED' by default
tutorials.api-settings-tutorial: API for developers, to integrate Lumia directly in their apps and tools
tutorials.advanced-settings-tutorial: Settings that you normally don't touch unless you are 100% sure that you know what you do or if a dev tells you so
tutorials.reset-tutorial: Be careful this will reset all the selected settings for your profile you can't undo this step

brands.fast-warn: {{brand}} is currently using Fast mode so Lumia won't be able to trigger Hue's native scenes. Use {{brand}} Regular mode to enable native scenes again

shortcuts.shortcut-description: Trigger events with a click of a button

premium.unlimited-commands-description: Create as many commands as you want with no limitations
premium.tts-upgrade: Add some more flavor to your alerts by announcing what's going on on stream live. Choose from random voices, different languages, and so much more!
premium.heartratesync-upgrade: Create a heart rate visualizer with your lights! With Heart Rate Sync mode you can have your lights sync with your heart rate using our integration with Pulsoid, HypeRate, and Ableton!
premium.themes-description: Trigger native themes that you've created in your light apps
premium.fuze-description: Sync your lights to your screen and music using Fuze
premium.edit-command-upgrade: Starter Plans can only have a max of 8 commands. Upgrade to premium or delete commands to edit your existing chat commands
premium.chat-match-upgrade: Have the ability to trigger anything for any chat command that comes in. This could be with an audio ping, a quick light change, or even sending every chat message to OSC. Upgrade to premium today to unlock this plus so much more
premium.add-command-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to add unlimited chat commands
premium.overlay-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to use the Lumia Overlay with your stream
premium.chatbot-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to enhance your chat with Lumia Chat Bot
premium.twitch-chatbot-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to enhance your chat with Lumia Twitch Chat Bot
premium.add-twitch-points-command: Starter Plan Twitch Points Commands Exceeded
premium.add-twitch-points-command-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to add unlimited Twitch Point Commands
premium.edit-twitch-points-command-upgrade: Starter Plans can only have a max of 8 Twitch points commands. Upgrade to premium or delete commands to edit your existing Twitch Points commands
premium.add-twitch-extension-command: Starter Plan Twitch Extension Commands Exceeded
premium.add-twitch-extension-command-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to add unlimited Twitch Extension Commands
premium.edit-twitch-extension-command-upgrade: Starter Plans can only have a max of 8 Twitch extension commands. Upgrade to premium or delete commands to edit your existing Twitch extension commands
premium.streamdeck-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock the ability to use your Stream Deck in all of it's glory with Lumia
premium.touchportal-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock the ability to use your Touchportal in all of it's glory with Lumia
premium.hotkeys-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock the ability to use hotkeys in all of it's glory with Lumia
premium.devices: Key Lights and Smart Plugs Locked
premium.devices-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock the ability to add Key Lights and Smart Plugs to your light commands
premium.alias-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock aliases for your commands
premium.twitter-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to unlock Twitter actions for your commands
premium.animations-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to fully use Lumia. Animations gives you the ability to setup advanced sequences that are much more powerful than reactions. Individually change the duration, target individual lights, play an audio, trigger Key Lights, Smart Plugs, Keylight, MIDI, OSC, and so much more inside each individual slot
premium.userlevels-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to add users in their own user levels. You no longer have to rely on sticking to Subscriber, Mods, VIPS, now you can define your own custom user levels
premium.themes-upgrade: Trigger native themes that you've created in your light apps
premium.buildups-upgrade: Studio buildups, not to be confused with Twitch buildups, starts a buildups event when triggered. Lights will start at 0 brightness and move up based on how many emotes come in from your users.
premium.fuze-upgrade: Sync your lights to your screen and music using Fuze
premium.profiles-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to switch profiles
premium.temperature-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to activate different color temperatures
premium.obs-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to control OBS states with your commands
premium.slobs-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to control Streamlabs Desktop states with your commands
premium.api-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to use Lumia's API with your commands
premium.midi-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to control Midi with your commands
premium.osc-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to send OSC signals with your commands
premium.artnet-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to control Art-Net DMX with your commands
premium.mqtt-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to send MQTT signals with your commands
premium.serial-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to send Serial signals with your commands
premium.broadlink-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to send Broadlink signals with your commands
premium.variations-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to start customizing your alerts with variations
premium.youtubemusic-upgrade: Give your community the ability to change your song, pause, play, or even turn down the volume while an activity is happening!
premium.vlc-upgrade: Give your community the ability to change your song, pause, play, or even turn down the volume while an activity is happening!
premium.voicemod-upgrade: Voicemod will give your viewers the ability to change your voice in a flash!
premium.streamerbot-upgrade: Streamerbot will give your viewers the ability to change your voice in a flash!
premium.trial-description: You can try all of these features for 7 days free
premium.webhook-upgrade: Upgrade to premium to start using webhooks
